name: Realistic Vietnam - Halong Bay/ Phu Quoc Island
summary: Vietnam will surprise you with its rich traditional culture, a host of world heritage sites, stunning inland scenery, and world-renowned cuisine. Start your tour in Hanoi - Vietnam's colonially influenced atmospheric capital, escape from the hustle and bustle of big cities in Ba Vi countryside, then be ready to be amazed by the most famous bay in Vietnam with the "dragon" in its name. Head to the South and discover the amazing network of Cu Chi tunnels which was used by Viet Cong during Vietnam War then explore the life of locals alongside the mighty Mekong River. Feel the essence of calming ocean in Phu Quoc which is a raw beauty, immerse yourself with white sand and emerald water sea, stay close with nature and sunbathing on the beach.

timeline.title: DAY 01: WELCOME TO VIETNAM - HANOI ARRIVAL
timeline.description: Upon arrival, our driver will be holding a sign with your name and welcome you at Noi Bai International airport transfer to Hanoi Old Quarter and drop off at hotel to check in. The rest of the day, you can stroll around the Old Town to get used to the City or just relax to recover from the jet lag. Overnight in Hanoi

timeline.title: DAY 02: EXPERIENCE VIETNAMESE LIFESTYLE IN COUNTRYSIDE
timeline.description:
08:00 – Start your trip to Ri village in Ba Vi. After 1.5 hours’ driving, you will arrive at Mr Duoc’s house with a welcome drink.
10:00 – Then visiting the 30-year-old tea plantation in Ri Village. This is a green and peaceful place where you can enjoy beautiful scenery of the village. This Tea Plantation plays important role in providing tea products for the whole north of Vietnam. You will have a chance to help local family to harvest tea leaves, you will know how to pick the best part of the tea tree to make the most wonderful beverage as Vietnam traditional tea.
Mr Duoc is a veteran of Vietnam War and the owner of a large tea farm. He also is an expert in handling the raw tea leaves, he will introduce you how to make a good green tea before selling.
You will have great time listening to the host’s stories of his life in Vietnam war, besides, enjoying great tea with green lentils or lotus seeds that made by his family.
11:15 – Driving about 10 minutes to visit another host family in Moc Village to give you a cooking class by Mrs. Chin – a host family. She will show you how to cook Vietnamese food, and you will have great time to enjoy the lunch you cooked.
12:30: Have lunch with the host’s family and short break after lunch. Then you will be head back to your hotel. The rest of the day is at your leisure. 
Overnight in Hanoi
(Meals: breakfast, lunch)

timeline.title: DAY 03: CRUISING TO EMERALD WATER - SHARING CRUISE, BUS
timeline.description:
Explore Bai Tu Long Bay – Thien Canh Sơn – Cap La.(L.D) 
07h30: Pick up from your hotel in Hanoi. Drive to Ha Long City through the green fields in the Red River Delta.
10h00: Stopover on the way for a refreshment break.
12h00: Embark at Ha Long wharf – Break and photography time
12h30: Boat Cruises on Halong, enjoy a welcoming drink and cruise briefing.
13h30: Have lunch while cruising in Bai Tu Long Bay, admiring the fascinating rock formations in the bay.
15h30: Transfer by tender to Thien Canh Son cave. Our tour guide will take you to a huge cave with many interesting stalactite and stalagmite in different amazing shapes …. After about half an hour visiting, you will go back to tender and return to the boat. Then return to cruise for your leisure or join sunbathing, enjoy swimming in the crystal clear water or join with cooking class by our chef.
19h00: Vietnamese style set dinner is served on board.
21h00: Take some leisure time to enjoy chatting at the bar or enjoy some night fishing. Stay overnight on boat.
(Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner)

timeline.title: DAY 04: MORNING IN VIETNAM'S MOST STUNNING BAY (B/L) SHARING CRUISE
timeline.description:
Explore Vung Vieng floating village by Bamboo boat.
07h30: Have breakfast and enjoy sunrise on the bay.
09h00: Visit ancient Vung Vieng floating village you are not only be immersed in the quiet and peaceful atmosphere, but also be surrounded by the rocky mountains by small bamboo boat for an hour in to the ancient village then return to cruise for relaxing and check out the room.
10h30: Have lunch while cruising back through Ha Long Bay to the pier
11h30: Disembark at Ha long wharf, time to say goodbye to the crew.
12h00: Return from Ha Long to Hanoi.
14h00: Stopover on the way for a refreshment break.
16h00: Arrive in Hanoi. 
(Meals: breakfast, lunch)

timeline.title: DAY 05: TRAVEL FROM TRANQUIL HANOI TO VIBRANT HO CHI MINH CITY
timeline.description:
After breakfast, our driver will pick you up at the hotel lobby and transfer to the airport for flight to HCMC, Arrival, our guide and shuttle bus will holding a sign with your name and welcome you. Transfer directly to hotel in HCMC. After check in, free for leisure and shopping in the local markets.
Overnight in Ho Chi Minh 
(Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: DAY 6: EXPLORE THE FASCINATING UNDERGROUND SYSTEMS (B)
timeline.description:
Have breakfast and check-out from the hotel. Depart for Cu Chi tunnel at 8:00 - 8:30 am, the trip will take approximately one and a half hours bus driving. Upon arrival, before exploring the tunnels, you will have some short introduction followed by video about how the tunnels were constructed and how the people survived in the harsh conditions of the war time. Then, spend your time exploring the remaining area and tunnel systems which includes the special constructed living areas with kitchens, bedrooms side by side with other martial facilities like storage, weapons factories, field hospitals, and command centers. Besides, there are also many hidden trap doors and dangerous traps within the maze-like tunnels for security purpose during the war. Afterward, native Cu Chi tapioca will be served. 
Break time for relax or time for those who want to try the real shooting gun. 
13:00 – 13:30 Drop off at your hotels. Trip ends.
(Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: DAY 7: DISCOVER THE "RICE BASKETOF VIETNAM"
timeline.description:
The Mekong Delta (from Vietnamese "Nine Dragon river delta") is the region in South-western Vietnam where the Mekong River approaches and falls into the sea through a network of distributaries. 
07.30 – 08.00 am: Pick you up at your hotel. Then have an unforgettable drive along the provincial roads, down to the Southern region of Vietnam, through paddy rice fields, pineapple plantations, orchards and small hamlets (2-hour drive). 
After arrive at My Tho, you will take a local motor boat and have a sightseeing tour of Dragon, Phoenix and Turtle Islands and stop at the famous Unicorn Island. At the Unicorn Island, you will visit honey bee  farm, taste some honey wine, rice wine and banana wine. Then have a walk around the village and row the boat along the natural water coconut canals to see local daily life in Mekong Delta.
From there, you will continue your motor boat trip to Ben Tre province to visit a handmade coconut candy workshop. Then transfer to a small motor boat and travel along the lush, green canals, and stop at local restaurant for lunch.
After that we are going to another area on the Unicorn Island to enjoy some kinds of tropical fruits at the orchard garden and listen to the Southern traditional music.
Local boat will take you back to My Tho , then the bus will drive you back to Sai Gon.
16:00 – 16:30: Drop off at your hotels. Trip ends.
(Meals: breakfast, lunch)

timeline.title: DAY 8:FLY FROM HO CHI MINH CITY TO PHU QUOC (B)
timeline.description:
Have healthy breakfast then transfer to the airport to take flight to Phu Quoc Island –the most wonderful island of Vietnam.
(Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: DAY 9: CHERISH YOUR LEISURE TIME ON THE BEACH
timeline.description:
Have leisure time today.
Accommodate at the hotel.
(Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: DAY 10: GO SNOKELING & FISHING (B)
timeline.description:
Start at 08:30, finish at 16:45)
Meet at pick up point and visit a pearl farm to learn about the cultured pearl industry, then get to the harbor to board the boat. On the way there will be a stopover for fishing. Afterwards we dock at a beautiful island for snorkeling and swimming. Enjoy lunch onboard, then visit another island for more snorkeling. Our final stop on the return journey is Bai Sao, a beautiful beach with turquoise water and white sand.
(Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: DAY 11: TIME TO SAY GOODBYE PHU QUOC – HO CHI MINH DEPARTURE (B)
timeline.description:
From Phu Quoc island you will be transferred back to Ho Chi Minh city for departure flight.
Please NOTE: your International flight back home should be in the afternoon
(Meals: breakfast)

timeline.title: Day 3: Excursion full day - Y Linh Ho - Lao Chai - Tavan Village (B, L)
timeline.description:
9:30 AM, start from Sapa Ethnic (04 Hoang Dieu Str) on the main road to go down to Muong Hoa valley. At the start of the trip you are able to see a panorama view of this hilltop town before beginning your walk. After 4km on the main road, we start going down to the valley by the small trails through the terrace rice fields to get to Y Linh Ho hamlet, a small village of the Black Hmong people.
From Y Linh Ho village, we go along the river to go to Lao Chai village (means "old village" in the local dialect). It is time for you to visit the local families, listen to your guide's explanation about the local culture: how they live, way of building the traditional house, techniques of making clothes... or just feel free to chat.
Stop for local lunch. 
In the afternoon, we leave Lao Chai to continue to Ta Van village. Here your are welcomed to a family where you can immerse yourself in their culture, listen about their life, enjoy some green tea and learn about the differences from the other hill tribes even.
After which we head up to the main road where the car will pick up us to transfer back to Sapa. Overnight in Sapa Town.
Bamboo Sapa Hotel 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 4: Sapa - Hanoi by Sapa Express Bus (B)
timeline.description:
Trekking from Sapa to Cat Cat Village you will see its waterfall and meet H’mong family and learn more about their way of life.
Cat Cat is a small but bustling village situated at the foot of Fansipan Mountain. Here you will see traditional H’mong homes at their best, and you will be able to meet a H’mong family to learn more about their way of life. The village is also the perfect place to see traditional clothing being made, hemp being dyed and women weaving. From Cat Cat we will follow the Muong Hoa Valley for 3km through rice terraces and small dwellings to Sin Chai. This village is a little off the usual trekking route and less visited, it offers the opportunity to see traditional wooden homes built using the indigenous Pumu tree. Transport will be waiting in Sin Chai to take you back to Sapa. 
15:30: Our car and guide will pick you up at the Sapa Tourism Information Center (inside) for departure back to Hanoi towards new Noi Bai - Lao Cai Highway. There will be 2 stops on the way for restroom (max 20mins/stop)
Arrive in Hanoi at 8:30 pm to 9:00 pm. End of the trip with sweet memories about our Sapa and Hill-tribe village of the north of Vietnam.
Check in hotel & overnight in Hanoi
Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 5: Hanoi - Halong Bay (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
7:30 am to 8:30 am: Pick up at your hotel in Hanoi Old Quarter 
Along the way to Halong Bay we will stop for a short break in an arts and crafts centre. Here you are able to watch local crafts being produced and grab a bite to 
12:00 pm We will arrive at the port before being transferred to Glory Legend Cruise
Welcome drink - receive cruise briefing, safety instructions and check in. 
Enjoy a lunch with Vietnamese dishes served while sailing through the bay, passing the imposing limestone formations. 
You shall then board your bamboo craft piloted by indigenous locals. They will take you through a stunning cave formation into a tranquil bay where if you are lucky you can spot monkeys.
Next you are able to relax on the beach at Ti Top where you are able to swim in the warm water, get some rays or treck to the top of the outcrop for stunning panorama views.
Back to the boat and you have free time while sailing to Luon Bo area, and anchor overnight.
Attend the Cooking class on sundeck. Then enjoy Happy Hour (Buy one drink-get one free). Sit back and relax while watching the magnificent sunset over Halong Bay.

Evening activities include: Leisure time to enjoy a chat around the bar, watching movies and many sort of Vietnam cultural films, relaxing and spending a romantic night on Glory Legend Cruise’s music, playing cards, chess are available, reading magazines in room and dining room. You may also try your luck at squid fishing & fishing from the boat.

name: Vietnam Beach Fun Holiday - Nha Trang/ Dalat
summary:
​Vietnam is a beach lovers' dream as it is a perfect place to enjoy the sun, sand and sea. Enjoy a beach break that has been in high demand between the tourists, in 9 days you will explore Ho Chi Minh City, continue to Dalat which is a combination of beautiful spots and artificial structures. Then move to Nha Trang - tourists favorite place thanks to its bleached sand and azure-blue waters perfect for the top-notch diving and snorkeling.
This Vietnam Beach Fun tour  is a perfect combination to enjoy the sun and the sea and learn about new cultures.

timeline.description:
Your trip begins with arrival in Vietnam. Your private driver will meet you at the airport and transfer you to the hotel. Check-in at the hotel and have a rest after the flight. 
If you arrived early, you can mooch through the streets of the city. Historic charm, architectural marvels, and products’ variety are splashed all over this area.

timeline.title: DAY 2: EXCRUSION ON THE MIGHTY MEKONG DELTA (B/L)
timeline.description:
Start 7.20am – return around 17.30 
7:20am Pick up from hotel.
Kick start your day with a hearty breakfast and a trip to Mekong Delta follows, depart for My Tho, the town lies on the left side of the Mekong River. Boarding the sampan and cruising down the river around the four beautiful islands known as Dragon, Unicorn, Phoenix and Tortoise islands.
Stop over at Unicorn Island, go walking around country lane and seeing orchards, enjoy tropical fruits, folk song music which performed by the local people. Visit the fruit plantation. 
Riding a hand-rowed sampan through Thoi Son canal and treat yourself in the beauty of the countryside, visit the family business, visit honey-bee farm, enjoy honey tea and coconut candy workshop. 
Have lunch at local restaurant. Break time. 
In the afternoon, time for cycling around the Tan Thach village, meet the local villagers to experience the local daily life in the Mekong delta. Hammock relaxing and enjoy cool breeze for those can’t join the cycling trip. Return to Ho Chi Minh
( Meals : Breakfast, Lunch )

timeline.description:
Today you’ll land in Hanoi. Warmly welcome by Tour Guide & Car Driver at airport then transfer to Hanoi Downtown, a city of lakes, shaded boulevards, public parks, and the capital of Vietnam. Take part in Water Puppet Show. Check into your hotel. Stay overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Hanoi - Halong Bay Cruise & stay overnight on Board (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
9:00am: Early this morning, we’ll drive from Hanoi to one of the most magnificent scenic environments in the world, Halong Bay. Covering 577 square miles, this vast bay is filled with more than 3,000 limestone “peaks” or karsts that jut from the deep blue water as far as the eye can see. We’ll spend a day and a half, including an overnight with dinner and breakfast onboard, exploring this overwhelming seascape from the decks of a traditional Vietnamese boat. Comfortable and intimate, your boat features hand-crafted wooden interiors including a dining room and pleasant air-conditioned cabins with private baths. Since we’re overnight on the water, we’ll be able to explore Ha Long Bay’s most beautiful spots with time to swim and even visit some of the largest rock formations and caves. This promises to be one of your most memorable travel experiences in Asia. Stay overnight on Boat.
Garden Bay Cruise 3* or similar

timeline.title: Halong Bay Cruise - Hanoi. (B, L)
timeline.description:
Rising to the sound of lapping bay waters, we have time for an early morning dip followed by breakfast. Sitting on the upper deck, you can relax while taking in the breath-taking beauty of the rocky islands rising from the emerald water of the bay.
After breakfast, explore Sung Sot cave, swim and relax. Cruises back to the jetty while brunch is served while you are cruising through the bay, along the way seeing more of the fascinating formations. Cruise check-out. Rejoin car drive back to Hanoi. Short break in the middle way is available (20 minutes)
Arrive hotel in Hanoi around 4:00pm. Check in hotel and overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Ho Chi Minh City Tour - Cu Chi Tunnels (B, L)
timeline.description:
Today you will visit the largest Vietnamese city. There are street markets, sidewalk cafes and sleek new bars. This teeming metropolis offers 300 years of timeless traditions and the beauty of an ancient culture. To the west of the city is the huge Chinese neighborhood called Cho lon, which means "Big Market." Notre Dame Cathedral, in the heart of Saigon's government quarter, is of neo- Romanesque architecture with two high square tower and iron spires. The Central Post Office is French-style and City Hall, known as "Hotel de Ville," is typical of the French architecture that would be seen in any village in France. Visit the War Remnants Museum, featuring collections of weapons and photographs from the two Indochina wars. Leave Saigon for Cu Chi Tunnels to learn about Vietnam history & Vietnam War. Return to hotel for free. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.
Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon 3* or similar

name: Sai Gon Highlights 5 days 4 nights
summary: Asia Focus Travel with package 5 days 4 nights in Saigon  and Mekong Delta Tour is one of the most popular tours attracting all domestic and foreign tourists. Nothing is more fascinating to visit a heroic district in the anti-American war and see a wonderful tunnels system in Cu Chi Tunnels. Moreover, you can explore Ho Chi Minh City with magnificent French architecture in War Crime Museum, Reunification Hall, Notre Dame Cathedral and General Post Office. This is a perfect opportunity to get more deep knowledge in heroic history and creativity of Cu Chi people hundreds of years ago. You can visit Unicorn Island, Turtle Island with many different types of tasty tropical fruits and witness how to make candy and handcrafted products from coconut. Moreover, you will experience the daily life of Mekong Delta people on Cai Rang floating market.

timeline.title: Day 1: Ho Chi Minh City (No Meal)
timeline.description: Welcome to Saigon! You will be met at the airport and transferred to hotel in Sai Gon. After checking into the hotel, the rest of the day is yours to enjoy. Sai Gon is a bustling, dynamic and industrious centre, the largest city in the country, the economic capital and the cultural trendsetter. Yet within the teeming metropolis are the timeless traditions and beauty of an ancient culture. Overnight in Saigon.

timeline.title: Day 2: Sai Gon - My Tho - Ben Tre - Can Tho (Breakfast, Lunch)
timeline.description:
Pick up at hotel and departure for Mekong delta trip.Enjoy the scenic journey along the National Highway bordered by green rice fields. On arrived at My Tho, visit Vinh Trang pagoda, take a leisurely boat ride along the river, view stilt houses, fruit plantations and fishing villages along the river bank. Proceed to Tortoise islet, have lunch in the orchard garden. Then a boat ride to An Khanh – a less touristy attraction in Ben Tre, enjoy cruising on a hand-rowed sampan under the shade of the water coconut trees along natural canals, then enjoy seasonal fruit& honey tea to the sound of "Southern Vietnamese folk music", performed by the locals. Visit a family business which epitomizes the idyllic rural lifestyle, taste delicious coconut candy& observe the pastoral life as you roam through fruit plantations and villages.  Proceed to Can Tho. 
Overnight in the hotel (family home-stay with dinner can be arranged on request). Free time to visit bustling Can Tho market

timeline.title: Day 3: Cai Rang floating Market - Can Tho - Sai Gon (Breakfast, Lunch)
timeline.description:
Take a leisurely boat trip to explore the picturesque tributaries of the Lower Mekong river ( Bassac River), then proceed to visit CaiRăng floating market (& Phong Dien is optional), which are the liveliest in the whole religion.
Have you ever tasted Vietnamese vermicelli soup? Well, now go and see how it is made. Then wander around the village and meet the friendly local people and experience how to cross a "Monkey bridge" which is built by only o¬ne stem of bamboo. Visit the orchard garden. Stop for lunch. Back to HCM city. Overnight in Saigon

timeline.title: Day 4: Sai Gon - Cu Chi Tunnels (Breakfast, Lunch)
timeline.description:
•  Breakfast at hotel. At 08.00am our guide will pick you up from hotel and depart for Cu Chi - Located 60km from Saigon, Cu Chi is now considered a heroic district for its role in the anti - American war in Vietnam. It is legendary for its tunnels system of over 220km and is a popular spot for both Vietnamese and foreign visitors.
•  The peacefully rural rice paddy scenery contains ducks and water buffalos swimming in the rivers alongside the road. Visitors will find it hard to imagine the destructions, damage and defoliation all over the area, caused by bombing and mines when Cu Chi was "A Free Target Zone". The remnants visitors will see that Cu Chi still has her evidence to prove the fierce battleground that took place there and visitors will see the remnants.
•  Have a lunch at the local restaurant.
•  After lunch, we will visit War Crime Museum (This museum tells the story of war from the Vietnamese perspective. Exhibits include photographs, machinery, and weapons that depict the harsh realities of war).
•  Reunification Hall which was the residence of the President Ngo Dinh Diem of the former South Vietnam until 1975 (1960s - Apr 1975s). You will see many interesting things: formal meeting rooms, private bedrooms, war situation rooms 10 meter beneath earth’s level.
•  This address today still holds many important functions in HCMC. We have guide who speaks your language to tell you important historical facts about this building and some French colonial structures including the Notre Dame Cathedral (Located in the heart of the city, this cathedral was built by the French in the late 1877s. A large statue of the Virgin Mary greets you as you walk into this neo-Romanesque cathedral, adorned by two tall spires flanking either side).
•  General Post Office (Designed by Gustav Eiffel, the Post Office is a testament to the French presence in the late 1800s. The look and feel of this grand building is like an elegant railway station).
•  Stay overnight in Saigon.

timeline.title: Day 5: Ho Chi Minh City (Breakfast)
timeline.description: Have breakfast at hotel. Free at leisure. Check out hotel. Our guide & driver will transfer you to Tan Son Nhat airport for departure flight. End of Saigon Mekong Tour 5D4N (My Tho, Ben Tre, Can Tho).

name: Vietnam Highlights - 9 Days
summary:
The best quality and unbeaten price for 9 Days Trip
100% Guaranteed Departure
NO hidden Cost, NO Optional
Start in Ho Chi Minh City and finish in Hanoi
Boat trip cruise on Mekong Delta
Visit Hanoi, stay in Boutique hotel inside the Old Quarter
Stay overnight on Boat in Halong Bay - World Heritage Site
Escape from City to Bakhan Village Resort - the best brand new Mountain resort in the Northwest of Vietnam
Taste wonderful Vietnamese local cuisines along the trip
And more...
highlights: Discover enchanting caves and fishing villages on Halong Bay
Spend the night on aquamarine waters on a traditional junk boat
Step back in time to times of war in the mysterious Cu Chi Tunnels

timeline.title: Day 1: Arrival Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
timeline.description:
Today you’ll land in Ho Chi Minh City (Tan Son Nhat International Airport). Warmly welcome by Tour Guide & Car Driver at airport then transfer to hotel for check in. Stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.
Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 2: Full day to Mekong Delta/River Boat Trip. (B, L)
timeline.description:
Today takes you to My Tho, the capital of Tien Giang Province. Situated on the Mekong River, 75 kilometers southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, the city is surrounded by orchards and rice fields, which produce grain for the entire country. Visit one or two of the islands that produce traditional handcrafts, coconut candy and bee farms. Visit the Vinh Trang Pagoda, the oldest one in the delta on your boat trip on the Mekong River. Return to Ho Chi Minh City. Check in hotel & stay overnight in Ho Chi Minh City.
Liberty Parkview Hotel Saigon 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 3: Ho Chi Minh City Tour - Cu Chi Tunnels (B, L)
timeline.description:
Today you will visit the largest Vietnamese city. There are street markets, sidewalk cafes and sleek new bars. This teeming metropolis offers 300 years of timeless traditions and the beauty of an ancient culture. To the west of the city is the huge Chinese neighborhood called Cho lon, which means "Big Market." Notre Dame Cathedral, in the heart of Saigon's government quarter, is of neo- Romanesque architecture with two high square tower and iron spires. The Central Post Office is French-style and City Hall, known as "Hotel de Ville," is typical of the French architecture that would be seen in any village in France. Visit the War Remnants Museum, featuring collections of weapons and photographs from the two Indochina wars. Leave Saigon for Cu Chi Tunnels to learn about Vietnam history & Vietnam War. After Cu Chi Tunnels you will take flight to Hanoi by Vietnam Airlines. Arrive Hanoi in the evening. Transfer to hotel for check in. Stay overnight in Hanoi.
Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 4: Full day sightseeing Hanoi City Tour (B, L)
timeline.description:
Hanoi, a city of lakes, shaded boulevards and public parks, is the capital of Vietnam. It is a very attractive city with French-style architecture. You have a full day of sightseeing ahead, including a visit to One Pillar Pagoda, which was built by Ly Thai Tong and the Temple of Literature, founded by Emperor Ly Thanh Tong. Stop in the heart of Hanoi at Hoan Kiem Lake, which contains an islet with a tiny Tortoise Pagoda. After lunch at a local restaurant, visit Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, the Opera House and St. Joseph Cathedral. Conclude with a visit to Bao Tang Lich, once the museum of l'Ecole Francaise d'Extreme Orient, which includes artifacts from Vietnam's turbulent history. Water Puppet Show, Cyclo visiting Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi.
Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 5: Hanoi - Halong Bay Cruise stay overnight on Board (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
Early this morning, we’ll drive from Hanoi to one of the most magnificent scenic environments in the world, Halong Bay. Covering 577 square miles, this vast bay is filled with more than 3,000 limestone “peaks” or karsts that jut from the deep blue water as far as the eye can see. We’ll spend a day and a half, including an overnight with dinner and breakfast onboard, exploring this overwhelming seascape from the decks of a traditional Vietnamese boat. Comfortable and intimate, your boat features hand-crafted wooden interiors including a dining room and pleasant air-conditioned cabins with private baths. Since we’re overnight on the water, we’ll be able to explore Ha Long Bay’s most beautiful spots with time to swim and even visit some of the largest rock formations and caves. This promises to be one of your most memorable travel experiences in Asia. Stay overnight on Boat.
Garden Bay Cruises 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 6: Halong Bay Cruise - Hanoi. (B, L)
timeline.description:
Rising to the sound of lapping bay waters, we have time for an early morning dip followed by breakfast. Sitting on the upper deck, you can relax while taking in the breath-taking beauty of the rocky islands rising from the emerald water of the bay.
After breakfast, explore Sung Sot cave, swim and relax. Cruises back to the jetty while brunch is served while you are cruising through the bay, along the way seeing more of the fascinating formations. Cruise check-out. Rejoin car drive back to Hanoi for overnight. Arrive Hanoi at 3:00pm. Check in hotel & free time to go sightseeing in the Old Quarter. Overnight in Hanoi.
Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 7: Hanoi - Mai Chau Valley - Ba Khan Village Resort (B, L, D)
timeline.description:
08h30. Depart from Hanoi. Enjoy a scenic drive along one of the most beautiful country road to the peaceful Bakhan Village via Hoa Binh City.
10:30: Take a short break for tea/coffee in the middle way.
12h00. Lunch at Bakhan Village Restaurant. Check-in room.
15h00. Afternoon walk around the Muong Village of Khan Ha and village’s West hill for a breath taking view of the valley.
19h00. Dinner time at Bakhan Restaurant.
20h00 -21h00. Enjoy the unique traditional dance by Villagers
Overnight at Bakhan Village Resort
Bakhan Village Resort 4*

timeline.title: Day 8: Bakhan Village - Hanoi (B, L)
timeline.description:
09h00. Take another great workout in nature with our East Mountain trek route. 
11h00. Back to the resort. Rest and relax 
12h00. Check out. Enjoy lunch at the resort
13h30. Depart for Hanoi.
17h00. Arrive Hanoi Old Quarter.
Check in hotel and overnight in Hanoi.
Pomihoa Hotel Hanoi 3* or similar

timeline.title: Day 9: Hanoi Conclude/ Departure. (B)
timeline.description: You have the morning free to relax before your return flight home. You`ll be transferred by Legend Travel Group to airport! Finish your unforgettable trip at airport! Good bye and see you again!

name: Hanoi - Halong bay - Sapa 7 days
summary: 7 days tour covers Hanoi city with highlights, Halong bay with overnight cruise & kayaking, Sapa with trekking to hill tribe minority villages . All in one tour 7-day with us at very competitive price and true experience.

timeline.title: Day 1: Hanoi Arrival
timeline.description: Arrive in Noi Bai airport  ( Hanoi ) , warmly welcomed by our guide & driver then transfer to the city. Hanoi or “River-bound City” as its name literally means is Vietnam’s capital with a thousand-year-old history dating back to 1010. The city’s fascinating beauty which is characterized by unique cultural relics, ancient streets of antique houses, elegant French colonial buildings, tree-lined boulevards and romantic lakes has made it one of the most charming cities of Asia. Check in hotel and relax after long journey.

timeline.title: Day 2: Hanoi City Tour
timeline.description:
8.30 you are picked up at your hotel, beginning Hanoi city  tour by visiting Ho Chi Minh complex, including Ho Chi Minh’s Mausoleum – the final resting place of Vietnamese great father or Uncle Ho, President Ho Chi Minh’s stilt house- where he lived on and off from 1958 to 1969. The next place to move to is One Pillar Pagoda – a group of structures consisting of a pagoda and a tower built in the middle of a square lake. Leave One Pillar Pagoda for the Temple of Literature – the first college of Vietnam and the place dedicating to Confucian. Have lunch at restaurant, enjoy  taste of authentic Hanoi cuisine.
In the afternoon, choose one of the city’s museums (History Museum and Ethnology Museum, Hoa Lo Prison which once known as “Hanoi Hilton”). Back to Hoan Kiem Lake – the heart of Hanoi capital, visit Hoan Kiem Lake (Restored Sword Lake) with Ngoc Son Temple before taking one hour cyclo tour through the Old Quarter, also known as the 36 streets, this bustling area of narrow streets is home to literally thousands of small business and shop-keepers. It’s a great place to explore with plenty of photo opportunities.

timeline.title: Day 3: Hanoi - Halong Bay
timeline.description: Private transfer to Halong bay with your guide.  On arrival, boarding on boat and settle at your cabin and enjoy a seafood lunch while cruising around amaze islets amid dramatic natural scenery. On the way to visit Sung Sot Cave – one of the most impressive caves in Ha Long, you have time relaxing on boat and admire magnificent limestone such as Dinh Huong mount, Ga Choi (cock Fighting Mount), you also visit floating villages. Keep sailing on the bay to Hidden Cave, stop for kayaking, swimming, snorkeling in emerald water, admiring sunset.  Enjoy a fresh seafood dinner before having good time of squid fishing and retiring to sleep in your cabin

timeline.title: Day 4: Halong Bay - Hanoi
timeline.description:
Greeting by the morning sun rise from the sea horizon, you can join a Thai Chi lesson for some morning exercise before breakfast. Continue boating to explore some of the bay’s truly awesome scenery – vertical and unusual rocks and islets emerge from the sea. If weather permitting, there will be an opportunity to swim in the clear waters. Boat disembarks around 11:00 am then transfer back Hanoi.
On arrival, . 
Check in hotel and free at leisure for discover Hanoi by night. Stay overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 5: Hanoi - Sapa - Cat Cat Village/ by Limousine Van
timeline.description:
Have early breakfast at hotel, then you will be picked up at hotel and depart to Sapa. Enjoy 5,5 hours driving on luxury van with good  air- condition, cool water, and snack. The van is equipped with only 9 flight seats instead of the normal 16 seats. The van stop 2 break time within 20 minutes. Arrive in Sapa town around 13.00. Our local guide meet you at hotel/ bus station and takes you to restaurant for lunch.  
14.30 : Visit  Cat Cat village, about 45 minutes’ walk from Sapa, this is the village of Black H’Mong hill tribe. The village is on the slope of the hill and easy walking, rice and corn are grown here.
Visiting Cat Cat village, you will have a chance to visit a big waterfall on the stream and the old Hydro Electric Power Station built by French people. That is the image of young women sitting by looms with colorful pieces of brocade decorated with designs of flowers and birds. When these pieces of brocade are finished, they are dyed and embroidered with beautiful designs. A noteworthy is that H’Mong women use indigo plants and leaves to dye these brocade fabrics. And then they roll around and smooth section of wood covered with wax on fabrics to polish them, making their colors.
Evening: After dinner, you are free to explore the charm of Sapa by night, enjoy roasted corn, baked eggs beside charcoal fire or go shopping. Especially on Saturday night, we highly recommend a stop at the Love Market which is one of unique cultures of ethnic minorities HMong, Dzao in Lao Cai in particular and North West of Vietnam in general.

timeline.title: Day 6: Sapa - Fansipan Mountain - Hanoi / By Limousine Van
timeline.description:
After breakfast at hotel, you are free for relaxing at hotel or discover Sapa town by your own. Visit Sapa Church, or visit Ham Rong Mountain by yourself. HamRong Botanical Garden: don't miss the lovely botanical gardens above the main square in town with their spectacular viewpoint from the top. There are fabulous views of the town and the wider landscape as well as tended gardens to visit.  This park is essentially a long cobblestone walkway to the top of Ham Rong Mountain.   It's a strenuous climb, but the panoramic vista at the top is well worth tackling all those stairs.  Along the way, there are countless potted orchids, beautiful landscaped gardens and a few really tacky statues of cartoon characters like Scooby Doo and Mickey Mouse.   One word of caution, the stone stairs could be treacherous on a rainy or misty day.  
After lunch, transferred to Fansipan Cable Station by private van for an amazing trip to reach the Indochina Roof, 3143m above the sea level: Starting by cable car and step up to the Peak, enjoy the fresh air and the beautiful landscapes from the high.
Return to the Station and transfer back Sapa town and ready to go back Hanoi. Take luxury van to go Hanoi, arrive in Hanoi around 21.30.

timeline.title: Day 7: Hanoi Departure
timeline.description: Free at your leisure until time to go Noi Bai airport for departure flight. End trips.

name: Simply Vietnam - Ninh Binh/ Mekong Delta
summary: Let's get lost in stunning panoramas of Vietnam discovery. The tour will start in colonial Hanoi - the elegant capital, graceful yet fast-paced city. Then cruising on emerald waters among the peaks of Vietnam most famous bay. And savoring the spectacular view of Hoalu -Tam Coc in Ninh Binh province which popular known as "Inland Halong Bay". Explore the Southern part of Vietnam with vibrant Ho Chi Minh City and riverside life of local people alongside the mighty Mekong River.

timeline.title: WELCOME TO VIETNAM - HANOI ARRIVAL
timeline.description: Upon arrival at Vietnam’s Airport, our driver will welcome you and transfer you to hotel in Hanoi. The rest of your day is at leisure for independent exploration – just catch a sight of the city or explore the maze of streets in the city’s fascinating centre where you are certain to find something unique to buy

timeline.title: MEET THE CHARMING CAPITAL OF VIETNAM
timeline.description:
The pick-up starts from 7.30 am to 8 am. 
The colonial capital city Hanoi is a unique Asian city with tree-lined boulevards, French colonial architecture, peaceful lakes and oriental pagodas and temples dating back thousand years ago.
This full day tour takes you around Hanoi's most interesting sights, including the Ho Chi Minh Complex: Ho Chi Minh's Mausoleum and his Stilts House, Presidential Palace and the One Pillar Pagoda nearby, and the Old Quarter also known as the 36 streets and guilds. Also on the tour - the Lake of the Restored Sword and Ngoc Son Temple, the Temple of Literature, peaceful West Lake with lovers street Thanh Nien, the sedate Tran Quoc Pagoda and Quan Thanh Temple and one of the city's museums, either the History Museum or the Ethnology Museum. 
Please note that the HCM Mausoleum is closed on Fridays and Mondays and most museums are closed on Mondays.
(Meals: breakfast, lunch)

timeline.title: EXPLORE A LOST WORLD IN HOA LU, TAM COC - NINH BINH - GROUP TOUR (B/L)
timeline.description:
Pick-up at 8:30 am at your hotel lobby. You leave Hanoi and head south for a 2-hour drive along Highway One or former Road Mandarin. You spend one hour visiting the Dinh and Le temples of the Ancient Capital Hoa Lu and then you move to Van Long for lunch. You may also enjoy an optional oxcart ride to Van Long Wharf for a 2-hour boat trip along the Van Long River. Along the way you will see caves, green rice fields, limestone mountains and the rural life of the locals before returning to Hanoi at 6:00 pm. 
(Meals: breakfast, lunch)

timeline.title: EXCRUSION TO THE NATURAL WONDER OF THE WORLD - GROUP TOUR (B/L)
timeline.description:
In the morning, check-out from hotel and get pick-up by the Cruise. 
The pick-up time will start from 7.30 am to 8 am. Take a route most scenic to reach Halong Bay, taking you across the Red River Delta with emerald green rice paddies stretching for as far as the eyes can see. On arrival at Halong, you get to enjoy a cruise on the Bay to better explore the limestone rocks and the karst grottoes. 
After you are done with your exploration of the bay, it is time to enjoy an utterly delicious seafood lunch, after which a trip to the famous limestone cave in Ha Long bay, you’ll get to spend some time here, kayaking or swimming, so that you can get closer to the floating villages and shops. Towards the evening, you will return to the boat for an early dinner, followed by some time at leisure. You can opt to attend the activities taking part in the boat or relax for the day.
Overnight on cruise
Note:  In case of bad weather (the boat is not allowed to push off or not allowed to overnight in the sea), the Ha Long bay tour could be cancelled without notice. We will consider other replacement tour or refund based on the specific circumstances
(Meals: breakfast, lunch, dinner)

timeline.title: MORNING IN THE MOST FAMOUS BAY - FLIGHT TO HO CHI MINH CITY (B/L)
timeline.description:
Rise early for a lesson in Tai Chi or just to enjoy a hearty breakfast. The boat will make its way back to the port stopping at the Limestone Cave, full of stalagmites and stalactites. From here, it’s clear sailing back to the main harbor and the return Hanoi around 17:00. Go straight to the airport for your flight to Ho Chi Minh city – called by Sai Gon – The Gem of Indochina.
Overnight in Sai Gon
Note:  In case of bad weather (the boat is not allowed to push off or not allowed to overnight in the sea), the Ha Long bay tour could be cancelled without notice. We will consider other replacement tour or refund based on the specific circumstances. 
Go straight to the airport for your flight to Ho Chi Minh city – called by Sai Gon – The Gem of Indochina.
Overnight in Sai Gon
(Meals: breakfast, lunch)

timeline.title: SAILING THROUGH MEKONG DELTA - GROUP TOUR (B/L)
timeline.description:
Mekong Delta Gateway Day Trip starts at 8:00 am from the lobby of guests's hotel in Saigon with a drive to My Tho, the capital of Tien Giang Province 72 kms from Ho Chi Minh City (Former Saigon) Guests will take time to visit Vinh Trang pagoda, the most beautiful pagoda of the province with mixture structure of many styles.
Then take a boat trip around 4 beautiful islets: Dragon, Unicorn, Phoenix and Tortoise. These evergreen islands among the Mekong River still remain unknown to many people. You will discover beautiful landscapes along the river and observe the typical Mekong delta rural life. Stops on the way can be made upon request for particular visits or photos making. Visit traditional house at Quoi An village (all made of coconut). See coconut collection set and how locals make handicrafts from trunk and shell, guests can see that they waste nothing, coconut is even useful for weddings and funeral.
Enjoy seasonal fruit and listening to traditional music. Take horse cart on village path and stop at Ben Truc orchard, taste honey with tea or Mekong whisky (they have a funny rule for guests to get in). Take rowing-boat on water palm creek. Take boat to visit coconut candy mill (special product of Ben Tre province). Enjoy fantastic lunch at local restaurant before coming back to Saigon.
(Meals: breakfast, lunch)

timeline.title: BIGGEST FAREWELL AND WAMREST THANK YOU - HO CHI MINH DEPARTURE
timeline.description:
Depending on your flight time, you will have leisure time which is arranged by yourself for the last waking, cycling around, shopping souvenirs or handicraft products or having coffee as a local for the last time before we take you to the airport for your flight. 
End of the service at the airport
Goodbye and safe travel.
(Meals: breakfast)

name: Classic Vietnam - Saigon to Hanoi 8 Days
summary: This is the perfect journey for travelers who seek for an introduction to Vietnamese heritage, culture, wonders and cuisine. The trip takes in a half day trip to he underground network of Cu Chi Tunnels; the sights of UNESCO World Heritage-listed Hoi An on foot; cyclo tour of Hanoi's Old Quarter to learn about traditional Vietnamese architecture; and a night cruising Halong Bay aboard a traditional Junk.

timeline.title: Day 1: Welcome to Ho Chi Minh City [formerly Saigon]
timeline.description: Upon your arrival at Tan Son Nhat airport in Ho Chi Minh City, met and transferred to your hotel. The remainder of the day is at leisure.Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City

timeline.title: Day 2: Sights & Sounds of the Bustling City
timeline.description: Today you'll embark on a guided city tour, starting with the War Remnants Museum - a real eye-opening part of Vietnam's proud history; followed by the Reunification Palace; the former South Vietnam Presidential Palace; the Notre Dame Cathedral and Old Post Office, as you get your camera working overtime peeking into the past of Vietnam's biggest, most energetically progressive city.After a tasty lunch at a local restaurant, continue with a Chinatown walking tour through the back streets to be part of the local daily life. Stop off for a visit to Thien Hau temple, which was built in the early 19th Century in tribute to the goddess of seafarers. Delve deeper into Chinatown by visiting the amazing Cholon and Binh Tay Market (or Ben Thanh market) for an insight into where the locals actually shop. Then you'll be back at your hotel in time to have a bit of a stroll around the city centre, or simply relax.Overnight in Ho Chi Minh City

timeline.title: Day 3: Visit Cu Chi Tunnels - Flight to Danang, Transfer to Hoi An
timeline.description: This morning a 1,5-hour drive will take you to Cu Chi Tunnels where you will visit the amazing network of underground tunnels was used during the Vietnam War by the Viet Cong. This huge construction was a habitation for villagers in the war time. With 3 levels of depth, it was never discovered by the US during the Vietnam War despite its proximity to Saigon. Visit the fighting tunnel system with your local guide. Return to Saigon after lunch for a late afternoon flight to Danang On arrival, pick up and transfer to your hotel in the downtown of Hoi An. Meals: Breakfast, Lunch Overnight in Hoi An

timeline.title: Day 4: Hoi An - Guided Walking Tour & Free Afternoon of Leisure
timeline.description: After breakfast, your guide will meet you at your hotel lobby to give you a proper show-around of the old town. You'll start a walking tour with a lion's share of places of interest: the 400-year old Japanese Covered Bridge; the Phuc Kien Assembly Halls; the museum and the colorful local market. Following the narrow lanes, you'll meander through tiny streets studded by houses influenced by Chinese, Japanese, French and European architectures. After such gallivanting, your time will be your own to wander around or getting amongst some retail therapy. The remainder of the day will be your own!Overnight in Hoi An

timeline.title: Day 5: Morning Flight to Hanoi; Afternoon City Tour of Hanoi & Water Puppet Show
timeline.description: Morning transfer to Danang airport for a short flight to Hanoi. On arrival, you will be picked up and and transferred to your hotel in the downtown.After lunch, visit The Temple of Literature, which, dating back to 1070, is Vietnam’s oldest university. You will then visit Ngoc Son Temple and Hoan Kiem Lake - the Ngoc Son Temple is set on a tiny island on Hoan Kiem Lake, its history dating back to the 13th century; a cyclo ride for 1 hour touring through the narrow, chaotic streets of the Old Quarter - a must for any visitor to Hanoi! The day finishes with a traditional performance of the famous Vietnamese water puppets. Overnight in Hanoi.

timeline.title: Day 6: Hanoi - Halong Bay (Join with other travelers on the cruise)
timeline.description: At 08.00, you will be picked up at your hotel and start the scenic 3.5 hour drive to Halong Bay, one of the most spectacular UNESCO World Heritage Areas and the world's largest marine limestone 'karst' landscape. Enjoy the landscape of the Red River Delta countryside and have a short break en-route. Meet the crew upon boarding the traditional wooden junk, then relax and enjoy lunch while the boat heads towards the secluded islands. Visit a fishing village by a rustic rowing-boat, meet the local people and pass through the floating school and pearl farms. Return to the junk refreshed and and relax on sundeck with a drink to watch the sunset. Enjoy a freshly prepared seafood dinner under the stars.Overnight on a traditional junk boat in Halong Bay

timeline.title: Day 7: Halong Bay Cruising – Return to Hanoi
timeline.description: Enjoy an early morning swim/Taichi (if weather permits) followed by breakfast. You will visit a famous ancient limestone cave in the middle of the bay where you’ll discover magnificent stalagmites and stalactites as you walk along the lit paths on a guided tour. Enjoy a tasty brunch while cruising back to the main harbor Pier where your private car will be waiting for you and transfer you back to Hanoi. Overnight in Hanoi

timeline.title: Day 8: Depart Hanoi
timeline.description: Your time will be your own until being picked up to head to Noi Bai Airport for your onward journey or departure flight home.
